Author: Mylo#8306

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content:
```
FAUCET=228
HEIR=234
CHANNEL=235
ORACLE=236
GATEWAY=241
CCENABLE=$FAUCET,$HEIR,$CHANNEL,$ORACLE,$GATEWAY
```

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: those are the enabled CCs

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: changing CCs changes consensus

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: so it can only be done at mandatory updates

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and it's dangerous

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: adding new CCs is not so dangerous as changing an existing CC

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: LABS people know the most

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @gcharang the current code does not default adaptivepow to be enabled for new chains, it seems better to require a specific -ac_adaptivepow=1 in the ac params

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that keeps the same exact KMD chain creation command  backward compatible as well, meaning the same exact thing even in the future 游녨

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c https://github.com/jl777/komodo/pull/1709

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@jl777c  a chain that has `-ac_adaptivepow=1` in launch parameters will have APoW and a chain that doesn't include the param `ac_adaptivepow` will have the normal PoW. `-ac_adaptivepow=-1` is meaningless and invalid.
is that correct?

Author: redp1ll#3268
Content: Hi guys, as I understand the selection of Antara modules has to be defined at the initiation of a Smart Chain. Does that mean that a hard-fork is always necessary when intending to add modules that will be developed along the way?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@redp1ll in most cases adding a new Antara module doesn't need a hardfork
modifying an existing Antara module will definitely need a hardfork

Author: redp1ll#3268
Content: @gcharang ok I see, so in case I want to change the tokens module for example, there would be the option of cloning the existing module and modifying it as needed to avoid a hard fork?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
```
change the tokens module
```
depending on what changes you are doing, it will need a hardfork

Author: redp1ll#3268
Content: well I wouldn`t be changing the module itself but the copy of it and add it to the chain as a new  module (tokens 2.0).

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
even then if you want the new module to modify/interact with tokens created using the old module, it will cause a hardfork depending on the specifics

to avoid a hardfork tokensv2.0 shouldn't interact with the old tokens

Author: redp1ll#3268
Content: Got it, thanks for the explanation!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @gcharang correct. i will probably make -1 an illegal parameter for adaptivepow

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: got it

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @gcharang @redp1ll pretty sure that adding a new Antara module is also a hardfork/mandatory update. It's a change to consensus rules

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: You can sometimes add a new Antara module and not cause a consensus change, but if somebody made a transaction with the new Antara module, older code without that would diverge into a different history. The chain would fork

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: if none of those happen, things would be fine

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: https://kmdlabs.com has a framework for updating Antara modules nicely, if you think you will be doing that a lot
